DataElement.preferredName: Negation Study Subject Administration, Management Performed Study Activity Variance Reason ISO21090.ST.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The completed study level administrative activity that is independent of a study subject. EXAMPLE(S): IRB Approval, site enrollment, FDA audit. A description of the variance of an administrative activity. EXAMPLE(S): Early or late occurrence of an activity, such as early withdrawal from study. Higher/lower amount of a transfer, such as transfer of less study agent than planned.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Negation Study Subject Administration, Management Performed Study Activity Variance Reason
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:A matter or an individual that is observed, analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or/and treated in the course of a particular study.:Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active._A cause of a difference between what is expected and what actually occurs, or a cause of an activity that varies from a norm or standard.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Negation Study Subject Administration, Management Performed Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.:A matter or an individual that is observed, analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or/and treated in the course of a particular study.:Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective; the state of being active.

Concepts.definition: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
A matter or an individual that is observed, analyzed, examined, investigated, experimented upon, or/and treated in the course of a particular study.
Performing or possessing executive duties; acting as a supervisor or manager.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: A cause of a difference between what is expected and what actually occurs, or a cause of an activity that varies from a norm or standard.

Concepts.definition: A cause of a difference between what is expected and what actually occurs, or a cause of an activity that varies from a norm or standard.
